alert.note: Alert for Bamberg; Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Kershaw; Lee; Richland; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 1:17PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Lee, Calhoun, Clarendon, southeastern Bamberg, Sumter, Orangeburg, Richland and southwestern Kershaw Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 116 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Killian to St. Matthews to Miley. Movement was east at 45 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Marion Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Sumter, Orangeburg, Forest Acres, Manning, Bishopville, Dentsville, South Sumter, Shaw Air Base, Brookdale, McEntire Air Base, St. Matthews, Holly Hill, Branchville, Summerton, Bowman, Arcadia Lakes, Eastover, Elloree, and Mulberry. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 69 and 93, and between mile markers 110 and 125. Interstate 26 between mile markers 141 and 169. Interstate 77 between mile markers 6 and 26. Interstate 95 between mile markers 85 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bamberg; Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Kershaw; Lee; Richland; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter
